properties.abstract: Looking at the map one recognises the special situation of Fluebrig: as the last cornerstone of the Druesberg range it breaks off in a 700 m high cliff to the north, towering above all adjacent hills and knolls by at least 500 m. This makes Fluebrig a landmark between Sihltal and WÃ¤gital, visible from afar. Even more: there is no other twothousander closer to the largest Swiss city. Between Zurich Bellevue and the peak the aerial distance is only 43 km. Actually there are three peaks, whose highest is called Diethelm. That is the one we want to explore here.
properties.subtitle: The twothousander closest to Zurich
properties.title: Traverse of Fluebrig from south to north

sac_photos.title: Fluebrig viewed from the west. The long, horizontal summit ridge called Diethelm is the highest point of the small mountain range.
